channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2023070773
item.description:
Report X-2023070773

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070773 SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE OF EVENTS IS UNKNOWN. DescribePack: THIS PKG CONTAINS FOUR PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF DISINFECTANT SOLUTION. UNFORTUNATELY, THIS PACKAGE BECAME DAMAGED WHILE IN TRANSIT. ALL OF THE CONTAINERS HAVE NO SEALS AND LOOSE CAPS. AS A RESULT, SOME OF THE LIQUID HAS LEAKED OUT OF THE CONTAINERS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PKG WAS PLACED IN A LARGE PLASTIC BAG AND PLACED IN OUR DAMAGED HAZMAT AREA. 2. X-2023070774 SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE OF EVENTS IS UNKNOWN. DescribePack: THIS PKG CONTAINS FOUR PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF DISINFECTANT SOLUTION. UNFORTUNATELY, THIS PACKAGE BECAME DAMAGED WHILE IN TRANSIT. ALL OF THE CONTAINERS HAVE NO SEALS AND LOOSE CAPS. AS A RESULT, SOME OF THE LIQUID HAS LEAKED OUT OF THE CONTAINERS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PKG WAS PLACED IN A LARGE PLASTIC BAG AND PLACED IN OUR DAMAGED HAZMAT AREA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler discovered this package coming down the NC belt and was damp on the bottom, he pulled it off to the side and let a member of management know which placed it inside a yellow hazmat drum and placed into the hazmat cage under ventilation. DescribePack: All four of their caps were loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was placed in a yellow hazmat drum and placed in the damage hazmat cage under the ventilation.

item.title: Report X-2023070687
item.description:
Report X-2023070687

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was found by Q.A. in the unload placed on the floor leaking from the upper corner. Q.A. placed the hazmat into a tote and took it the the cage to be evaluated and repacked into a salvage drum. DescribePack: one of the four bottles had a loose closure point and was leaking. the liquid caused the upper corner on the right-hand side to deteriorate. three inches of the corner of the box was soaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Q.A. isolated the leaking box into a tote until it could be contained in the cage and then repacked.

  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer forklift operator punctured a box with the forkblade from his forklift consequently puncturing an inner container contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured container.

item.title: Report X-2023070583
item.description:
Report X-2023070583

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: On 06/20/2023, during preload sort, a package containing two plastic one gallon bottles of Muriatic Acid was found to be damaged. Upon inspection by QA, it was discovered that the two plastic jugs were leaking contents from loose caps inside package DescribePack: two plastic jugs of Muriatic Acid leaking contents from loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery by QA, damaged package was placed in red plastic Fedex Ground Hazmat bin with plastic liner and staged in Hazmat cage on site for future processing

item.title: Report E-2023070289
item.description:
Report E-2023070289

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 6/20/2023 a Veolia employee from the Schenectady, NY office was loading drums from a trailer into another trailer at the Veolia, Schenectady, NY ten day intransit facility when the employee clipped a 55-gallon steel drum with the corner of a pallet while placing it in an outbound trailer. The leak occurred when the employee was loading drums into the trailer and the employee misjudged how close the pallet was to the drums that were already in the trailer for shipment. The 55 gallon drum containing flammable liquids was mostly dented but a small crease caused a leak from the drum and about a liter leaked out of the impacted drum. Liquid was only observed on trailer right below drum and did not leak out of the vehicle. The drum was overpacked into an 85 gallon salvage drum, the spill cleaned up, and transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued. The drum leaked about 1 liter of a class 3 flammable liquid solution. The liquid was cleaned up with spill pads and absorbent and the lid on the drum was overpacked properly to prevent it from spilling. The duration of release is anticipated to be less than 1 minute as the employee noticed the accident right away and an estimated 1 liter of flammable liquids leaked.
